ygData.subject: Re: Tailoring Question
ygData.msgSnippet: I guess I would like to make studded because that is the only way to increase skill after 26 ... === - Worlord News Reporter StarCraft Gurus
ygData.messageBody:
I guess I would like to make studded because that is
the only way to increase skill after 26

--- Reedo <reedo@...> wrote:
> From: "Reedo" <reedo@...>
>
> > Hail Fellow Monks
> >
> > I am a tailor of a good deal of experience and was
> > hoping that someone could answer a question for
> me. I
> > hunt in East Commonlands and therefore tailoring
> is a
> > simple skill to use because pelts are so common.
> > However, Patchwork has become too easy for me and
> I
> > have done some research into Studded Leather. As
> most
> > of you know, making studded armor requires studs.
> I
> > do not wish to take the time to make studs because
> > what I like most about tailoring is I do not have
> to
> > spend time doing it, I just kill animals and use
> their
> > pelts. Does anyone know if it is possible to buy
> > studs, or anyone on the Karana Server near
> Freeport
> > who sells them.
> >
>
> If you are pursuing making studded armor because of
> the satisfaction of
> having made your armor yourself I wish you good
> fortune. If you are making
> it because you want either to upgrade your armor or
> plan on selling it I am
> afraid you will most likely be disappointed.
> Studded armor unfortunately is
> far to difficult to make for the amount of
> protection it provides. For the
> studs you must find a talented blacksmith willing to
> make them for you. If
> you can find one they will most likely be priced at
> 1PP each. If you can
> find someone to make them for you I recommend
> spending all you can to get as
> many studs as possible. Because of the difficulty
> of studded armor you
> will go though many, many studs on your way a suit
> of armor. Also, the
> tailoring skill seems to improve very slowly after
> you have reached an
> ability of 26. The other problem is that studded
> armor does not provide as
> good protection as other types of armor you could
> find on the corpses of
> certain creatures in Norrath. But as I stated at
> the beginning, if you are
> able to make and wear a full suit of studded the
> self satisfaction could be
> well worth all other obstacles.
>
> --------
> Mark
>

> these out:
